questions.question: Find the values of x and y which satisfy the equations 2^x = 16 and 3^(2y) = 4 log_x (y + 3) = 1 + log_x 4.
Find the range of values of p for which the quadratic equation x^2 - 2px + p + 5 = 0 has (i) real roots, (ii) one positive and one negative root.
Consider the function f such that its derivative f'(x) = 2x^2 + 5x + 3 + 2k, where x and k are real numbers. Given that f is an increasing function, find the range of values of k.

The diagram shows a trapezium ABCD such that AD is perpendicular to DC and AB is parallel to DC. It is given that AB = (4 + 3√5) cm, DC = (11 + 2√5) cm and the area of the trapezium is (65 + 25√5) cm^2. Find the (i) length of AD in the form (a + b√5) cm.
length of BC, giving your answer in the simplest surd form.
Given that logaxp= and logayq= , find, in terms of p and q, 2logaax y.
Given that logaxp= and logayq= , find, in terms of p and q, log logxyax−.
Solve the equation (lg5 lg 3 2 1zz+ + =).

The table shows values of the variables x and y such that 2xy Ab= , where A and b are constants. Draw the graph of lny plotted against 2x, using a scale of 1 cm for 1 unit on the 2x-axis and a scale of 1 cm for 1 unit on the lny-axis.
questions.question_type: Converting from linear form to non-linear equation

questions.question: Use your graph to find the value of A and of b.

questions.question: On the axes below, sketch the graph of 24 12 y x x= − − , showing the coordinates of the points where the graph meets the axes.
State the set of values of p for which the line yp= intersects the curve 24 12 y x x= − − at four distinct points.
questions.question_type: Intersection of straight line and curve

questions.question: Find the x-coordinate(s) of the points of intersection between the curve y = x^2 - 12x - 24 and a line with equation y = 3x.
Given that y = 2sinx + 3cos3x, show that d^2y/dx^2 + 3dy/dx + ky = 0, where k is a constant to be determined.
questions.category: Differentiation of trigonometric, logarithmic, and exponential functions and their applications
questions.question_type: Applications of differentiation of trigonometric functions

questions.question: Find, in ascending powers of x, the first three terms in the expansion of (3 + 2x)^6.
Hence find the coefficient of x^2 in the expansion of (1 - 4x)(3 + 2x)^6.
Consider (1 - 2x)^6. Write down the general term.
Find the term independent of x in the expansion of (1 - 2x)^6.
Find the x-coordinates of the two stationary points on the curve y = x^2 ln x - 10x.
Determine the nature of each stationary point.
It is given that y = x^5 + 2x - 5. Find an expression for dy/dx and show that it can be written in the form 25kx/(x - 5).
Hence evaluate the integral from 3 to 7 of 25x/(x - 5) dx.
Show that tan 1 sec 2 1 sec tan sinxx x x x++=+.
Hence solve the equation tan 1 sec1 6sin1 sec tanxxxxx++ = ++ for 0 360x  .
